> "ABCDEF" is a "representation" of every-container possible because I
> declare it so.  That does not mean that it is valid HTTP to return
"ABCDEF"
> in response to a raw get for a specific container.  HTTP requires that the
> server return "whatever information" is associated with the underlying
> resource.

Alex, it could be you're reading too much meaning into "whatever".  I
read it to mean "whatever the implementation/authority deems fit", not
"every last bit of information possibly associated with the resource".
Isn't the latter just a bit extreme?

Walden
